intro: Caraxeron diffusus, commonly known as the wandering saxifrage, is a perennial herb native to arctic and alpine regions. It features a low-growing rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates. Caraxeron diffusus is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
